mapper.select: select sc.id, sc.staff_id, s.dep_id, s.staff_name, s.staff_code, sc.pre_basic_salary, sc.post_basic_salary, sc.pre_post_salary, sc.post_post_salary, sc.pre_accumulation_fund, sc.post_accumulation_fund, sc.pre_have_one_child_allowance, sc.post_have_one_child_allowance, sc.pre_safety_grade, sc.post_safety_grade, sc.pre_hot_weather_grade, sc.post_hot_weather_grade, sc.effective_date, sc.change_date, sc.executed, sc.remarks, sc.created_by, sc.created_date, sc.last_modified_by, sc.last_modified_date from hr_salary_change sc left join hr_staff s on sc.staff_id = s.id where sc.id = #{salaryChangeId}

select sc.id, sc.staff_id, s.dep_id, s.staff_name, s.staff_code, sc.pre_basic_salary, sc.post_basic_salary, sc.pre_post_salary, sc.post_post_salary, sc.pre_accumulation_fund, sc.post_accumulation_fund, sc.pre_have_one_child_allowance, sc.post_have_one_child_allowance, sc.pre_safety_grade, sc.post_safety_grade, sc.pre_hot_weather_grade, sc.post_hot_weather_grade, sc.effective_date, sc.change_date, sc.executed, sc.remarks, sc.created_by, sc.created_date, sc.last_modified_by, sc.last_modified_date from hr_salary_change where DATE_FORMAT(sc.change_date, '%Y-%m-%d') >= DATE_SUB(curdate(), interval #{days} day) and DATE_FORMAT(sc.change_date, '%Y-%m-%d') <= DATE_FORMAT(curdate(), '%Y-%m-%d')
